commit_message:
Support services in different namespaces

Pass the service namespace to kubernetes-entrypoint in
order to support dependencies between namespaces.
Add documentation about endpoint/service namespaces.

Change-Id: I208c3240e9f2c8900323595f7b0e488bef5cb1fc
Implements: blueprint entrypoint-namespaces

commit_message:
dashboard: impossible to add a bgpvpn with a empty route target

If the route targets, import targets or export targets are empty in the
django form, the creation or modification of the bgpvpn failed.
The neutron server return a error (Invalid input for export_targets.
Reason: '' is not a valid input.)
The route_targets are not correctly formatted and a empty string is sent
instead an empty list when the fields route_targets are empty in the form.

Change-Id: I3b233f68c12795713daf6c1a00042730eea84c56
Closes-Bug: 1730678

commit_message:
Tempest tests to check L3 BGPVPN RTs update

Added complex tempest tests that verify update of L3 BGPVPN route
targets in different conditions
- Change of RT to iRT<>eRT and again to only RT
- Change of RT to, RT with iRT<>eRT and again only RT
- Change of eRT<>iRT to RT with sequentional network association

Tests should check that update doesn't break connectivity when route
targets are defined properly and in opposite, when route targets
don't assure proper connectivity - it shouldn't be possible

Related-Bug: 1716893
Related-Bug: 1719822
Depends-On: Ia69e63d5e60ab539c40a2de373b5ffe4b46548f8
Change-Id: Ice15324e704048945e4371f4a7eb2e24744fefd7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/98/504198/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_bgpvpn_route_targets_update_disjoint_targets(self): """This test checks basic BGPVPN route targets update. 1. Create networks A and B with their respective subnets 2. Start up server 1 in network A 3. Start up server 2 in network B 4. Create L3 BGPVPN with only RT defined 5. Associate network A to a given L3 BGPVPN 6. Create router and connect it to network A 7. Give a FIP to server 1 8. Check that server 1 can ping server 2 9. Update L3 BGPVPN to have eRT<>iRT and no RT what is insufficient for proper connectivity between network A and B 10. Check that server 1 cannot ping server 2 11. Update L3 BGPVPN to have again only RT defined 12. Check that server 1 can ping again server 2 """ self._create_networks_and_subnets() self._create_servers() self._create_l3_bgpvpn(rts=[RT1], import_rts=[], export_rts=[]) self._add_network_associations_to_l3_bgpvpn() self._associate_fip_and_check_l3_bgpvpn(should_succeed=True) self._update_l3_bgpvpn(rts=[], import_rts=[RT1], export_rts=[RT2]) self._check_l3_bgpvpn(should_succeed=False) self._update_l3_bgpvpn(rts=[RT1], import_rts=[], export_rts=[]) self._check_l3_bgpvpn(should_succeed=True) @test.services('compute', 'network') def test_bgpvpn_route_targets_update_common_target(self): """This test checks basic BGPVPN route targets update. 1. Create networks A and B with their respective subnets 2. Start up server 1 in network A 3. Start up server 2 in network B 4. Create L3 BGPVPN with only RT defined 5. Associate network A to a given L3 BGPVPN 6. Create router and connect it to network A 7. Give a FIP to server 1 8. Check that server 1 can ping server 2 9. Update L3 BGPVPN to have eRT<>iRT and RT=iRT 10. Check that server 1 can ping server 2 11. Update L3 BGPVPN to have again only RT defined 12. Check that server 1 can ping again server 2 """ self._create_networks_and_subnets() self._create_servers() self._create_l3_bgpvpn(rts=[RT1], import_rts=[], export_rts=[]) self._add_network_associations_to_l3_bgpvpn() self._associate_fip_and_check_l3_bgpvpn(should_succeed=True) self._update_l3_bgpvpn(rts=[RT1], import_rts=[RT1], export_rts=[RT2]) self._check_l3_bgpvpn(should_succeed=True) self._update_l3_bgpvpn(rts=[RT1], import_rts=[], export_rts=[]) self._check_l3_bgpvpn(should_succeed=True) @test.services('compute', 'network') def test_bgpvpn_route_targets_update_and_unassociated_net(self): """This test checks basic BGPVPN route targets update. 1. Create networks A and B with their respective subnets 2. Start up server 1 in network A 3. Start up server 2 in network B 4. Create invalid L3 BGPVPN with eRT<>iRT that is insufficient for proper connectivity between network A and B 5. Associate network A to a given L3 BGPVPN 6. Create router and connect it to network A 7. Give a FIP to server 1 8. Check that server 1 cannot ping server 2 9. Associate network B to a given L3 BGPVPN 10. Check that server 1 cannot ping server 2 11. Update L3 BGPVPN to have only RT defined 12. Check that server 1 can ping server 2 """ self._create_networks_and_subnets() self._create_servers() self.router = self._create_router_and_associate_fip(0) self._create_l3_bgpvpn(rts=[], export_rts=[RT1], import_rts=[RT2]) self.bgpvpn_client.create_network_association(self.bgpvpn['id'], self.networks[0]['id']) self._check_l3_bgpvpn(should_succeed=False) self.bgpvpn_client.create_network_association(self.bgpvpn['id'], self.networks[1]['id']) self._check_l3_bgpvpn(should_succeed=False) self._update_l3_bgpvpn(rts=[RT1], import_rts=[], export_rts=[]) self._check_l3_bgpvpn(should_succeed=True) @test.services('compute', 'network')

commit_message:
Always search for ssh keys

This patch ensures that a list of public/private ssh keys is always
generated.

Closes-Bug: 1731049
Change-Id: Ibc6eecafe96b97107e14ae3d0f92c4ad6018228c
(cherry picked from commit bb9de6035520ab158e3b4fb03a209ebbe2d550cd)

subject: Fix filesystem permission masks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-09 16:45:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-hardening/commit/71c31bb9373771b3d1234f1722006771dbe4b960', 'message': "Fix filesystem permission masks

The setuid bit is ignored on directories, so it's not necessary
to remove it. The tasks currently remove the user's ability to
use their home directory.

The patch fixes the permissions problem, ensures that the 'nobody'
user is skipped, and enables testing for the tasks in the gate.

Closes-Bug: 1731005
Closes-Bug: 1730994
Change-Id: Id7be77b2eaa707c4c27d46f97d07f34825813749
(cherry picked from commit 79b3d25070f86804bd6cc4b04a82f2a9bb1f4982)
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-11-10 13:11:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-hardening/commit/873265c43c6687bf09b0fa6427a3bc67b96f0870', 'message': "Fix filesystem permission masks

The setuid bit is ignored on directories, so it's not necessary
to remove it. The tasks currently remove the user's ability to
use their home directory.

The patch fixes the permissions problem, ensures that the 'nobody'
user is skipped, and enables testing for the tasks in the gate.

Closes-Bug: 1731005
Closes-Bug: 1730994

commit_message:
Fix filesystem permission masks

The setuid bit is ignored on directories, so it's not necessary
to remove it. The tasks currently remove the user's ability to
use their home directory.

The patch fixes the permissions problem, ensures that the 'nobody'
user is skipped, and enables testing for the tasks in the gate.

Closes-Bug: 1731005
Closes-Bug: 1730994
Change-Id: Id7be77b2eaa707c4c27d46f97d07f34825813749
(cherry picked from commit 79b3d25070f86804bd6cc4b04a82f2a9bb1f4982)

commit_message:
Tempest tests with delete operations

Added tempest tests that check:
- lack of connectivity after bgpvpn delete
- lack of connectivity after network association delete
- lack of connectivity after router association delete

Change-Id: Ide1f3610b248a6e1fce15e0903d923c2bfb31b4f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/15/518315/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.services('compute', 'network') def test_bgpvpn_negative_delete_bgpvpn(self): """This test checks BGPVPN delete. 1. Create networks A and B with their respective subnets 2. Create L3 BGPVPN 3. Associate network A and network B to a given L3 BGPVPN 4. Start up server 1 in network A 5. Start up server 2 in network B 6. Create router and connect it to network A 7. Give a FIP to server 1 8. Check that server 1 can ping server 2 9. Delete L3 BGPVPN 10. Check that server 1 cannot ping server 2 """ self._create_networks_and_subnets() self._create_l3_bgpvpn() self._associate_all_nets_to_bgpvpn() self._create_servers() self._associate_fip_and_check_l3_bgpvpn(should_succeed=True) self.delete_bgpvpn(self.bgpvpn_admin_client, self.bgpvpn) self._check_l3_bgpvpn(should_succeed=False) @test.services('compute', 'network') def test_bgpvpn_negative_delete_net_association(self): """This test checks BGPVPN net association delete. 1. Create networks A and B with their respective subnets 2. Create L3 BGPVPN 3. Associate network A and network B to a given L3 BGPVPN 4. Start up server 1 in network A 5. Start up server 2 in network B 6. Create router and connect it to network A 7. Give a FIP to server 1 8. Check that server 1 can ping server 2 9. Delete association of network A 10. Check that server 1 cannot ping server 2 """ self._create_networks_and_subnets() self._create_l3_bgpvpn() body = self.bgpvpn_client.create_network_association( self.bgpvpn['id'], self.networks[NET_A]['id']) assoc_b = body['network_association'] self.bgpvpn_client.create_network_association( self.bgpvpn['id'], self.networks[NET_B]['id']) self._create_servers() self._associate_fip_and_check_l3_bgpvpn(should_succeed=True) self.bgpvpn_admin_client.delete_network_association(self.bgpvpn['id'], assoc_b['id']) self._check_l3_bgpvpn(should_succeed=False) @test.services('compute', 'network') def test_bgpvpn_negative_delete_router_association(self): """This test checks BGPVPN router association delete. 1. Create networks A and B with their respective subnets 2. Create router and connect it to network B 3. Create L3 BGPVPN 4. Associate network A to a given L3 BGPVPN 5. Associate router B to a given L3 BGPVPN 6. Start up server 1 in network A 7. Start up server 2 in network B 8. Create router and connect it to network A 9. Give a FIP to server 1 10. Check that server 1 can ping server 2 11. Delete association of router B 12. Check that server 1 cannot ping server 2 """ self._create_networks_and_subnets() router_b = self._create_fip_router( subnet_id=self.subnets[NET_B][0]['id']) self._create_l3_bgpvpn() self.bgpvpn_client.create_network_association( self.bgpvpn['id'], self.networks[NET_A]['id']) body = self.bgpvpn_client.create_router_association(self.bgpvpn['id'], router_b['id']) assoc_b = body['router_association'] self._create_servers() self._associate_fip_and_check_l3_bgpvpn(should_succeed=True) self.bgpvpn_admin_client.delete_router_association(self.bgpvpn['id'], assoc_b['id']) self._check_l3_bgpvpn(should_succeed=False)

subject: stable-maint: add stable-policy-relax policy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-13 21:48:40.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/stable-branches.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-team-guide/commit/9dc406e76979d4f6f3827726ce5283270af5a4fb', 'message': 'stable-maint: add stable-policy-relax policy

This adds a new policy, called "stable-policy-relax" which has similar
time frames as stable-policy but different supported changes.

Indeed, some projects (installers) are developing features that are
sometimes depending on other projects in OpenStack.
Example:
Neutron now supports OVN backends and complex DPDK environments.
Installers have to create automation recipes to deploy these new
environments but can't really do it before the feature is actually
finished (otherwise it can't be tested remember). That said, it makes
sense to give an extra-time (Phase I) for them to implement what's
called "Features" in installers, after a stable release.
The phases criteria are documented in the patch.

The intent isn't to let installers backporting everything or anything
but rather understand their use-cases and problems, and give to them
some extra time so they can deliver stronger tools available to our
operators and providing nice features for our end users; so we can
continue to be competitive etc.

A patch will be proposed in Governance to create stable-policy-relax tag
and explain (again) why we're doing this.

Change-Id: I390436eef5bc18f39432cccbd5d800ad92fb5c3e
'}]
commit_message:
stable-maint: add stable-policy-relax policy

This adds a new policy, called "stable-policy-relax" which has similar
time frames as stable-policy but different supported changes.

Indeed, some projects (installers) are developing features that are
sometimes depending on other projects in OpenStack.
Example:
Neutron now supports OVN backends and complex DPDK environments.
Installers have to create automation recipes to deploy these new
environments but can't really do it before the feature is actually
finished (otherwise it can't be tested remember). That said, it makes
sense to give an extra-time (Phase I) for them to implement what's
called "Features" in installers, after a stable release.
The phases criteria are documented in the patch.

The intent isn't to let installers backporting everything or anything
but rather understand their use-cases and problems, and give to them
some extra time so they can deliver stronger tools available to our
operators and providing nice features for our end users; so we can
continue to be competitive etc.

A patch will be proposed in Governance to create stable-policy-relax tag
and explain (again) why we're doing this.

Change-Id: I390436eef5bc18f39432cccbd5d800ad92fb5c3e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-team-guide refs/changes/68/511968/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: to reach that stability, we define several support phases in two policies. .. list-table:: stable-policy .. list-table:: stable-policy-relax :header-rows: 1 :widths: 10 20 20 50 - * Phase * Time frame * Summary * Changes Supported - * I * First 3 months * Latest release * All features and bugfixes (that meet the criteria described below) are appropriate - * II * 3-12 months after release * Maintained release * All bugfixes and security patches (that meet the criteria described below) are acceptable - * III * more than 12 months after release * Legacy release * Only critical bugfixes and security patches are acceptable .. note:: During Phase 1, features can be backported as long as they meet the following criteria: * The feature has to be documented in the tracker and approved by the PTL on behalf on the project team. * Features should not break anything *outside* of the project (external dependencies). For example, if a library used by some other projects in or outside OpenStack, the feature has to be fully backward compatible and no impact for the operator or end-user. * They are backported because they meet an important use-case and for some reasons, the code wasn't implemented during the latest cycle. * They can break dependencies that are part of the project, as long as it has been acknowledged by the project team and they plan to do the correct backports to leave clean internal dependencies. For example, if a library is only used by the project, the feature can be backported and doesn't have to be fully backward compatible because the team is aware about the interface changes and will make the correct backports to all pieces of code in the project to use the new interface. * Features would have to be documented and tested in the latest release's gate. During Phase 2, features can't be backported, although any bugfix or security patch can be backported, as long as it's fully backward compatible and tested.
deleted_lines: to reach that stability, we define several support phases. .. list-table::

commit_message:
Fix leak of password info in logs.

When launching a database instance, user info is logged at info
level.  This user info includes password information that should
not appear in the logs.  This fix removes logging of user info.

Change-Id: I97206a3fe0c19ee7cb7333ed27518134079f26d0

commit_message:
Tempest utility functions modified

Modifications of function for complex tests:
- more than 2 servers can be created
- more than 2 networks can be created
- more than one subnet in each network is possible
- subnets of the same CIDR are possible
- more than one L3 BGPVPN can be created
- L3 BGPVPN can be deleted in test
- tests between different servers are possible
- indexing of variables changed to keys for better
  readability
- port 80/http added to security group
- function to setup http name server added
- extracted function to setup ssh client
- extracted function to associate floating ip
- L3 BGPVPN check function optionally checks name of the
  destination server - is it the same as expexted
- L3 BGPVPN check function makes clear of ARP entry
  after first unsuccessful ping sequence

Change-Id: I2302a92e7228eaf5ddf1cafc13e30b97b224fcb0

SUSE: Reduced required distro packages

The devel_basis pattern pulls in far too many packages but we only need
gcc so use that instead.

commit_message:
add safe_clone_repo function

We have logic for dealing with cloning errors repeated in several
places. This patch combines it into one function that can be called
more easily without having to trap exceptions.

Change-Id: Ib5f6c3f801481b28513ce8fab0f5624c02e60d97
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/13/519413/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def safe_clone_repo(workdir, repo, ref, mk_error): """Ensure we have a local copy of the repository so we can scan for values that are more difficult to get remotely. """ try: clone_repo(workdir, repo, ref) except Exception as err: mk_error('Could not clone repository %s at %s: %s' % ( repo, ref, err)) return False return True

commit_message:
Revert "Introduce hpOneView and ilorest to OneView"

Reverting these changes because python-hpOneView does not provide HTTPS
secure connection with custom CAcert and could cause a possible security issue.

This reverts commit 3a5288a9adcb184ac4cc371816dc2ffa18695bbb.

Change-Id: I04d8435627873380bced7dc31f7469cdeb4bed12

commit_message:
Handle InstanceNotFound when setting password via metadata

When setting an instance password via the metadata service, if the
instance is not found it results in a 500 response to the caller.

This change handles the InstanceNotFound error and returns it as
a 400. Note it's a 400 since the instance uuid is part of the POST
request body, not on the URL path so it's not a 404 response.

Change-Id: I4aa99b563e1a5a87aa3e3dfb28800f107676df92
Partial-Bug: #1696848

commit_message:
Add shade-functional-tips jobs

shade provides a project-template to run its functional tests against
tips of key libraries, such as os-client-config and keystoneauth.

Add these to os-client-config so we can ensure we don't break anything.

Change-Id: I9619fc09ca7c0f6fd3021d3b5194131ad172ad16
Depends-On: I544fdf515f8df38d73cee64a6de799ab384a326e

commit_message:
Reviewing un-branched repositories

Adding a policy about reviewing
changes to un-branched repos.

Change-Id: I768999c9f86f25ea8454eb181c1074eb3eabfd67
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-specs refs/changes/88/478488/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, build the docs using tox, or see: http://rst.ninjs.org The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo?searchtext=awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst. For specs targeted at a single project, please prefix the first line of your commit message with the name of the project. For example, if you're submitting a new feature for oslo.config, your git commit message should start something like: "config: My new feature". Wrap text at 79 columns. Do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None If you would like to provide a diagram with your spec, ascii diagrams are required. http://asciiflow.com/ is a very nice tool to assist with making ascii diagrams. The reason for this is that the tool used to review specs is based purely on plain text. Plain text will allow review to proceed without having to look at additional files which can not be viewed in gerrit. It will also allow inline feedback on the diagram itself. ================================================ Merging submissions in un-branched repositories ================================================ There are several repositories like tripleo-ci or tripleo-quickstart-extras which are un-branched, so forth, the submissions related to these repositories need to be backwards compatible. Problem Description =================== There are submissions proposed and merged in un-branched repositories that breaks backwards compatibility with stable branches. Policy ====== For each submission proposed in any un-branched repository, there must exist a path checking that the submission is not breaking the jobs in any stable branch. Alternatives & History ====================== We are not currently following this approach on most of the changes, and we are just following our intuition that simple changes will just work. Implementation ============== Author(s) --------- Primary author: Carlos Camacho Other contributors: None Milestones ---------- Pike-3 Work Items ---------- For any submission proposing changes to un-branched repositories, there must provided the links in the commit message to verify that the submission is not breaking the stable branches. Revision History ================ .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Pike - Introduced .. note:: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode

commit_message:
Pass the CloudDomain parameter down to hiera on all nodes

We currently do not have a single hiera key that simply
returns the CloudDomain (Domain Suffix) that was configured
during the deployment. As it is a rather useful thing to have
on the overcloud nodes, let's pass it down for all roles.

IHA is at least one user where this information is needed in
hiera.

Change-Id: I7a510e3bbeb367a46bf6ccc565393b1e7a1a1f33

commit_message:
Vault based key manager

* Uses https://www.vaultproject.io/ to store/fetch secrets
* All we need is the URL and a Token to talk to the vault server
* tox target "functional-vault" sets up a server in development mode
  and runs functional tests
* Supports both http:// and https:// url(s)
* the https support was tested by setting up a vault server by hand
  (https://gist.github.com/dims/47674cf2c3b0a953df69246c2ea1ff78)
* create_key_pair is the only API that is not implemented

Change-Id: I6436e5841c8e77a7262b4d5aa39201b40a985255
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/castellan refs/changes/80/483080/25 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Key manager implementation for Vault """ import binascii import uuid import requests import six from castellan.common import exception from castellan.common.objects import symmetric_key as key from castellan.key_manager import key_manager from cryptography import fernet from keystoneauth1 import loading from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging DEFAULT_ROOT_TOKEN_ID = "7022703f-ab30-4285-bad7-6f414f81855f" # str(uuid.uuid4()) DEFAULT_LISTEN_ADDRESS = "127.0.0.1:8200" vault_opts = [ cfg.StrOpt('root_token_id', default=DEFAULT_ROOT_TOKEN_ID, help='root token for vault'), cfg.StrOpt('listen_address', default=DEFAULT_LISTEN_ADDRESS, help='Use this endpoint to connect to Vault, for example: ' '"%s"' % DEFAULT_LISTEN_ADDRESS), ] VAULT_OPT_GROUP = 'vault' _EXCEPTIONS_BY_CODE = [ requests.codes['internal_server_error'], requests.codes['service_unavailable'], requests.codes['request_timeout'], requests.codes['gateway_timeout'], requests.codes['precondition_failed'], ] LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class VaultKeyManager(key_manager.KeyManager): """Key Manager Interface that wraps the Barbican client API.""" def __init__(self, configuration): self.conf = configuration self.conf.register_opts(vault_opts, group=VAULT_OPT_GROUP) loading.register_session_conf_options(self.conf, VAULT_OPT_GROUP) self.session = requests.Session() def _get_url(self): return "http://%s" % self.conf.vault.listen_address def create_key_pair(self, context, **kwargs): """Creates an asymmetric key pair.""" raise NotImplementedError( "VaultKeyManager does not support asymmetric keys") def _store_key_value(self, key_id, value): headers = {'X-Vault-Token': self.conf.vault.root_token_id} resource_url = self._get_url() + '/v1/secret/' + key_id try: resp = self.session.post(resource_url, json={'value': value}, headers=headers) if resp.status_code in _EXCEPTIONS_BY_CODE: raise exception.KeyManagerError(resp.reason) if resp.status_code == requests.codes['not_found']: raise exception.ManagedObjectNotFoundError(resp.reason) except requests.exceptions.Timeout as ex: raise exception.KeyManagerError(six.text_type(ex)) except requests.exceptions.ConnectionError as ex: raise exception.KeyManagerError(six.text_type(ex)) return key_id def create_key(self, context, algorithm, length, **kwargs): """Creates a symmetric key.""" key_id = str(uuid.uuid4()) key_bytes = bytes(fernet.Fernet.generate_key()) key_value = binascii.hexlify(key_bytes) return self._store_key_value(key_id, key_value) def store(self, context, key_value, **kwargs): """Stores (i.e., registers) a key with the key manager.""" key_id = str(uuid.uuid4()) return self._store_key_value(key_id, key_value) def get(self, context, key_id): """Retrieves the key identified by the specified id.""" headers = {'X-Vault-Token': self.conf.vault.root_token_id} resource_url = self._get_url() + '/v1/secret/' + key_id try: resp = self.session.get(resource_url, headers=headers) if resp.status_code in _EXCEPTIONS_BY_CODE: raise exception.KeyManagerError(resp.reason) if resp.status_code == requests.codes['not_found']: raise exception.ManagedObjectNotFoundError(resp.reason) except requests.exceptions.Timeout as ex: raise exception.KeyManagerError(six.text_type(ex)) except requests.exceptions.ConnectionError as ex: raise exception.KeyManagerError(six.text_type(ex)) key_bytes = binascii.unhexlify(resp.json()['data']['value']) return key.SymmetricKey('AES', len(key_bytes) * 8, key_bytes) def delete(self, context, key_id): """Represents deleting the key.""" headers = {'X-Vault-Token': self.conf.vault.root_token_id} resource_url = self._get_url() + '/v1/secret/' + key_id try: resp = self.session.delete(resource_url, headers=headers) if resp.status_code in _EXCEPTIONS_BY_CODE: raise exception.KeyManagerError(resp.reason) if resp.status_code == requests.codes['not_found']: raise exception.ManagedObjectNotFoundError(resp.reason) except requests.exceptions.Timeout as ex: raise exception.KeyManagerError(six.text_type(ex)) except requests.exceptions.ConnectionError as ex: raise exception.KeyManagerError(six.text_type(ex))

subject: Use specified phrases in lieu of 'Used' for limit summary
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-04 18:09:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/1ece36e19f156fad98ff43b7c17b875e0d54e55b', 'message': 'Use specified phrases in lieu of 'Used' for limit summary

Some resources, namely floating IPs, are limited based on those allocated, rather than in actual use. The "Allocated" string is present in the code but not used in the template. This effectively changes "Used X of Y" to "Allocated X of Y" for floating IPs.

Change-Id: I7919b883a47d66b1e870862363d07e0f90bdbe7b

Change-Id: I7919b883a47d66b1e870862363d07e0f90bdbe7b
Closes-Bug: #1708733
'}]
commit_message:
Use specified phrases in lieu of 'Used' for limit summary

Some resources, namely floating IPs, are limited based on those
allocated, rather than in actual use. The "Allocated" string is present
in the code but not used in the template. This effectively changes "Used
X of Y" to "Allocated X of Y" for floating IPs.

Change-Id: I7919b883a47d66b1e870862363d07e0f90bdbe7b
Closes-Bug: #1708733

commit_message:
update_network should consider qos if or not name of network changes

update_network in ovn_client has the judgment of whether the name
of the network changes, update network should consider qos, so
delete the judgment in mech_driver.

Change-Id: Id98072daa82cbdeb27a8675a2250d73dfb5d2977

commit_message:
update_router(): Consolidate all commands in one transaction

This patch is modifying the update_router() method - and all the related
methods - to consolidade all commands into a single transaction.

This ensures consistency when updating the router resource since now all
changes to OVSDB are chained.

Change-Id: Ic06bdfcdc0f871e925e5a957ff29c290072bd02c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/73/515673/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Check for route updates routes = new_router.get('routes') if routes: added, removed = helpers.diff_list_of_dict( original_router['routes'], routes) self._update_lrouter_routes( context, router_id, added, removed, txn=txn) def create_router_port(self, router_id, port, txn=None): commands = [self._nb_idl.add_lrouter_port( name=lrouter_port_name, lrouter=lrouter, mac=port['mac_address'], networks=networks, **columns), self._nb_idl.set_lrouter_port_in_lswitch_port( port['id'], lrouter_port_name, is_gw_port=is_gw_port)] self._transaction(commands, txn=txn) def update_nat_rules(self, router, networks, enable_snat, txn=None): commands = [] for network in networks: commands.append( func(gw_lrouter_name, type='snat', logical_ip=network, external_ip=router_ip)) self._transaction(commands, txn=txn)

Error: %(error)s', {'router': router_id, 'error': e}) def create_router_port(self, router_id, port): with self._nb_idl.transaction(check_error=True) as txn: txn.add(self._nb_idl.add_lrouter_port(name=lrouter_port_name, lrouter=lrouter, mac=port['mac_address'], networks=networks, **columns)) txn.add(self._nb_idl.set_lrouter_port_in_lswitch_port( port['id'], lrouter_port_name, is_gw_port=is_gw_port)) def update_nat_rules(self, router, networks, enable_snat): with self._nb_idl.transaction(check_error=True) as txn: for network in networks: txn.add(func(gw_lrouter_name, type='snat', logical_ip=network, external_ip=router_ip))

commit_message:
Set dhcp_agent_notification to False for devstack

This avoids DHCP agent scheduling for non-router ports and eliminates
their WARNING logs[1].
But, this option does not work for router ports because they are out of
control[2] and seems there is no other similar option for router ports.

[1]neutron-server[5675]: WARNING neutron.scheduler.dhcp_agent_scheduler ... No more DHCP agents
   neutron-server[5675]: WARNING neutron.api.rpc.agentnotifiers.dhcp_rpc_agent_api ...
   Unable to schedule network cad77229-963b-492a-8213-f67cabde3b4d: no agents available; will retry on subsequent port and subnet creation events.
[2]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/a1aff7a4dce5b66e7228fe1c4cf3975194f9ec8c/neutron/api/rpc/agentnotifiers/dhcp_rpc_agent_api.py#L58-L71

Change-Id: I118f5d5c92e527c8c0ec5118d45eb58aac9d0c84
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>

commit_message:
Remove triplicated update_router_routes() method

There were 3 instances of the same method spreaded around the OVN code.
This patch removes the duplicated ones leaving only one definition as
part of the OVNClient class.

Change-Id: I7bca2913975975d0181edeb7b01903c338b828dc

commit_message:
Added zuulv3 jobs for testing neutron tempest plugin

* In order to test the tempest plugin, this patch adds following
  jobs against neutron repo.
  - neutron-tempest-plugin-api for api tests
  - neutron-tempest-plugin-dvr-multinode-scenario and
    neutron-tempest-plugin-scenario-linuxbridge for scenario tests

Depends-On: I42d389836e72813fdeebc797a577f4a8ac2ee603
Change-Id: Iab7f7bcec9597444041c6d6891b5e0d9a03ba039

subject: Update murano-cfapi-paste.ini with http_proxy_to_wsgi
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-13 14:38:51.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/use_http_proxy_to_wsgi-1c07317c60f62735.yaml', 'etc/murano/murano-cfapi-paste.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano/commit/bc46318f2312ea44587280fe81530f9dbcd15567', 'message': 'Update murano-cfapi-paste.ini with http_proxy_to_wsgi

Commit 02ec8d03ed53660470ae7623b7c0528a6207e97d updated
murano-paste.ini with http_proxy_to_wsgi. This commit does
the same to murano-cxfapi-paste.ini.

Murano used to have a custom, always-enabled ssl middleware, to parse
X-Forwarded-Proto header, to let murano work correctly behind an SSL
proxy. There is now an oslo middleware, that does the
same thing, but more thoroughly.

This commit replaces custom implementation with oslo one.

Change-Id: I7b12305de2b148cdcc629eaeb131869f50180832
Closes-Bug: #1731927
'}]
commit_message:
Update murano-cfapi-paste.ini with http_proxy_to_wsgi

Commit 02ec8d03ed53660470ae7623b7c0528a6207e97d updated
murano-paste.ini with http_proxy_to_wsgi. This commit does
the same to murano-cxfapi-paste.ini.

Murano used to have a custom, always-enabled ssl middleware, to parse
X-Forwarded-Proto header, to let murano work correctly behind an SSL
proxy. There is now an oslo middleware, that does the
same thing, but more thoroughly.

This commit replaces custom implementation with oslo one.

Change-Id: I7b12305de2b148cdcc629eaeb131869f50180832
Closes-Bug: #1731927
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/69/519369/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pipeline = cors request_id http_proxy_to_wsgi ext_context authtoken context cloudfoundryapi[filter:http_proxy_to_wsgi] paste.filter_factory = oslo_middleware.http_proxy_to_wsgi:HTTPProxyToWSGI.factory oslo_config_project = murano
deleted_lines: pipeline = cors request_id ssl ext_context authtoken context cloudfoundryapi[filter:ssl] paste.filter_factory = murano.api.middleware.ssl:SSLMiddleware.factory

commit_message:
Fix kolla tests

Jinja2==2.10 adds a namespace function here

https://github.com/pallets/jinja/blob/master/jinja2/utils.py#L615

That gets renamed in the tests as the default namespace making the tests
fail.

I've renamed the variable namespace to basenamespace to avoid the issue

Change-Id: I9bf50032c0a284acd4cc30d3b3854eb00f018d86
Partial-Bug: #1732140
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/19/519619/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% set namespace=basenamespace or "tripleoupstream" %}

commit_message:
Fix test_get_volume_config method

The current test does not check instance variables of
LibvirtConfigGuestDisk object.
So fix the test to check attributes of LibvirtConfigGuestDisk
object.

Change-Id: I14fb44eebf9d6f7623225dea46d143f7cb84d7fc
Closes-Bug: #1706399
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/67/489467/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _fake_libvirt_config_guest_disk(self): fake_config = vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestDisk() fake_config.source_type = "network" fake_config.source_device = "fake-type" fake_config.driver_name = "qemu" fake_config.driver_format = "raw" fake_config.driver_cache = "none" fake_config.source_protocol = "fake" fake_config.source_name = "fake" fake_config.target_bus = "fake-bus" fake_config.target_dev = "vdb" return fake_config def test_get_volume_config(self, _set_cache_mode, get_config): disk_info = {'bus': 'fake-bus', 'type': 'fake-type', config_guest_disk = self._fake_libvirt_config_guest_disk() get_config.return_value = copy.deepcopy(config_guest_disk) self.assertEqual(config_guest_disk.to_xml(), config.to_xml())
deleted_lines: @mock.patch.object(volume_drivers.LibvirtFakeVolumeDriver, 'connect_volume') def test_get_volume_config(self, _set_cache_mode, get_config, connect_volume): bdm = {'device_name': 'vdb', 'disk_bus': 'fake-bus', 'device_type': 'fake-type'} disk_info = {'bus': bdm['disk_bus'], 'type': bdm['device_type'], mock_config = mock.MagicMock() get_config.return_value = mock_config self.assertEqual(mock_config, config)

block_device_mapping_v2.bus_type is missing from api-ref

POST /servers API reference. This patch add it.

Closes-Bug: #1713895

commit_message:
Fix the expirer cron task to run correctly

We need to escape % for cron to run correctly. Without
this the cron task fails with syntax error.

Change-Id: I8eac2d978380ccc1c6998929c8aa6a440ed4bcce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/85/517385/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "sleep $((\$(od -A n -t d -N 3 /dev/urandom) \% 86400)) && ${::ceilometer::params::expirer_command}" }

"msgid "**On SLES for OpenStack Pike:**" msgstr "**OpenStack Pike를 위한 SLES 에서 :**" msgid "**On openSUSE for OpenStack Pike:**" msgstr "**OpenStack Pike를 위한 openSUSE 에서:**" msgid "**When installing the Pike release, run:**" msgstr "**Pike 릴리즈를 설치하는 경우, 다음을 실행합니다:**" "After installing the operating system on each node for the architecture that " "you choose to deploy, you must configure the network interfaces. " "배포판에 따른 네트워크 구성 방법에 대한 자세한 정보는 해당 문서를 참고하십시" "오." msgid ""msgid "" "Compute service – `nova installation for Pike <https://docs.openstack.org/" "nova/pike/install/>`_" msgstr "" "Compute 서비스 – `nova installation for Pike <https://docs.openstack.org/" "nova/pike/install/>`_" "Create and edit the ``/etc/etcd/etcd.conf.yml`` file and set the ``initial-" "cluster``, ``initial-advertise-peer-urls``, ``advertise-client-urls``, " "``listen-client-urls`` to the management IP address of the controller node " "to enable access by other nodes via the management network:" msgstr "" "``/etc/etcd/etcd.conf.yml`` 파일을 생성 및 편집하여 ``initial-cluster``, " "``initial-advertise-peer-urls``, ``advertise-client-urls``, ``listen-client-" "urls`` 를 관리 네트워크를 통해 다른 노드에 대한 액세스를 활성화도록 컨트롤" "러 노드에 대한 관리 IP 주소로 설장합니다:" msgid ""msgid "Create and edit the ``/lib/systemd/system/etcd.service`` file:" msgstr "``/lib/systemd/system/etcd.service`` 파일을 생성 및 편집합니다:" msgid "Enable and start the etcd service:" msgstr "etcd 서비스를 활성화한 후 시작합니다:" msgid "" "Enable the Open Build Service repositories based on your openSUSE or SLES " "version, and on the version of OpenStack you want to install:" msgstr "" "openSUSE 또는 SLES 버전, 그리고 설치하고자 하는 OpenStack 버전에 기반한 Open " "Build 서비스 저장소를 활성화합니다:" msgid "For RHEL or CentOS:" msgstr "RHEL 또는 CentOS에서:" msgid "For RHEL, CentOS, or SUSE:" msgstr "RHEL, CentOS, 또는 SUSE 에서:" msgid "For Ubuntu:" msgstr "Ubuntu 에서:" msgid "" "For more information on production architectures, see the `Architecture " "Design Guide <https://docs.openstack.org/arch-design/>`_, `OpenStack " "Networking Guide for Pike <https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/pike/admin/" ">`_, and `OpenStack Administrator Guides for Pike <https://docs.openstack." "org/pike/admin/>`_." msgstr "" "Production 아키텍처에 대한 자세한 정보는 `Architecture Design Guide <https://" "docs.openstack.org/arch-design/>`_, `OpenStack Networking Guide for Pike " "<https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/pike/admin/>`_, 그리고 `OpenStack " "Administrator Guides for Pike <https://docs.openstack.org/pike/admin/>`_ 를 " "살펴봅니다." msgid "" "For more information on registering the system, see the `Red Hat Enterprise " "Linux 7 System Administrator's Guide <https://access.redhat.com/" "documentation/en-US/Red_Hat_Enterprise_Linux/7/html/" "System_Administrators_Guide/part-Subscription_and_Support.html>`_." msgstr "" "시스템 등록에 대한 보다 자세한 정보는 `Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 System " "Administrator's Guide <https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-US/" "Red_Hat_Enterprise_Linux/7/html/System_Administrators_Guide/part-" "Subscription_and_Support.html>`_ 를 살펴 봅니다." "Identity service – `keystone installation for Pike <https://docs.openstack." "org/keystone/pike/install/>`_" msgstr "" "Identity 서비스 – `keystone installation for Pike <https://docs.openstack." "org/keystone/pike/install/>`_" msgid ""msgid "" "If your instance does not launch or seem to work as you expect, see the " "`Troubleshoot Compute documentation for Pike <https://docs.openstack.org/" "nova/pike/admin/support-compute.html>`__ for more information or use one of " "the :doc:`many other options <common/app-support>` to seek assistance. We " "want your first installation to work!" msgstr "" "인스턴스가 예상한대로 구동되지 않거나 동작하지 않는 것처럼 보이는 경우, 자세" "한 정보를 위해 `Troubleshoot Compute documentation for Pike <https://docs." "openstack.org/nova/pike/admin/support-compute.html>`__ 를 살펴보거나 도움을 " "찾기 위해 :doc:`many other options <common/app_support>` 중 하나를 사용합니" "다. 동작하는 첫 설치가 되기를 원합니다!" msgid "" "Image service – `glance installation for Pike <https://docs.openstack.org/" "glance/pike/install/>`_" msgstr "" "이미지 서비스 – `glance installation for Pike <https://docs.openstack.org/" "glance/pike/install/>`_" "In addition to ``rhel-7-server-rpms``, you also need to have the ``rhel-7-" "server-optional-rpms``, ``rhel-7-server-extras-rpms``, and ``rhel-7-server-" "rh-common-rpms`` repositories enabled:" msgstr "" "``rhel-7-server-rpms`` 뿐만 아니라, ``rhel-7-server-optional-rpms``, " "``rhel-7-server-extras-rpms``, 그리고 ``rhel-7-server-rh-common-rpms`` 저장소" "가 활성화될 필요가 있습니다:" msgid ""msgid "Install OpenStack services" msgstr "OpenStack 서비스 설치" msgid "Memcached for SUSE" msgstr "SUSE를 위한 Memcached" msgid "Message queue for Ubuntu" msgstr "Ubuntu를 위한 메시지 큐" msgid "Minimal deployment" msgstr "최소 배포" "Networking service – `neutron installation for Pike <https://docs.openstack." "org/neutron/pike/install/>`_" msgstr "" "네트워킹 서비스 – `neutron installation for Pike <https://docs.openstack.org/" "neutron/pike/install/>`_" msgid ""msgid "OpenStack Installation Guide" msgstr "OpenStack 설치 가이드" msgid "OpenStack packages for RHEL and CentOS" msgstr "RHEL 및 CentOS를 위한 OpenStack 패키지" msgid "OpenStack packages for SUSE" msgstr "SUSE를 위한 OpenStack 패키지" msgid "OpenStack packages for Ubuntu" msgstr "Ubuntu를 위한 OpenStack 패키지" msgid "OpenStack services" msgstr "OpenStack 서비스" msgid "" "OpenStack services may use Etcd, a distributed reliable key-value store for " "distributed key locking, storing configuration, keeping track of service " "live-ness and other scenarios." msgstr "" "OpenStack 서비스들은 분산 키 잠금 관리, 구성 저장, 서비스가 살아있는지 및 다" "른 시나리오에 대한 지속적인 추적을 위한 안정적인 분산 키-값 저장소인 Etcd를 " "사용할 수 있습니다." msgid "" "OpenStack services support various security methods including password, " "policy, and encryption. Additionally, supporting services including the " "database server and message broker support password security." msgstr "" "OpenStack 서비스에 대한 암호, 정책, 암호화를 포함한 다양한 보안 방법을 지원합" "니다. 추가적으로 데이터베이스 서버와 암호 보안을 지원하는 브로커를 포함한 서" "비스를 지원합니다." msgid "" "RHEL, CentOS and SUSE distributions enable a restrictive :term:`firewall` by " "default. During the installation process, certain steps will fail unless you " "alter or disable the firewall. For more information about securing your " "environment, refer to the `OpenStack Security Guide <https://docs.openstack." "org/security-guide/>`_." msgstr "" "RHEL, CentOS 및 SUSE 배포판에는 기본적으로 :term:`firewall` 이 활성화되어 있" "으며, 제한된 범위만을 허용하고 있습니다. 설치 과정에서, 몇몇 단계는 방화벽 설" "정을 변경하거나 해제하지 않는 이상 실패할 것입니다. 사용자 환경에 대한 보안" "을 강화하는 것에 대한 자세한 정보는 `OpenStack Security Guide <https://docs." "openstack.org/security-guide/>`_ 를 참고하십시오." msgid "" "RHEL, CentOS and SUSE distributions enable a restrictive :term:`firewall` by " "default. Ubuntu does not. For more information about securing your " "environment, refer to the `OpenStack Security Guide <https://docs.openstack." "org/security-guide/>`_." msgstr "" "RHEL, CentOS 및 SUSE 배포판에는 기본적으로 제한된 범위만을 허용하는 :term:" "`firewall` 이 활성화되어 있으나 Ubuntu는 그렇지 않습니다. 사용자 환경에 대한 " "보안을 강화하는 것에 대한 자세한 정보는 `OpenStack Security Guide <https://" "docs.openstack.org/security-guide/>`_ 를 참고하십시오." msgid "The OpenStack architecture" msgstr "OpenStack 아키텍처" msgid "The OpenStack services" msgstr "OpenStack 서비스" "The Training Labs scripts provide an automated way of deploying the cluster " "described in this Installation Guide into VirtualBox or KVM VMs. You will " "need a desktop computer or a laptop with at least 8 GB memory and 20 GB free " "storage running Linux, MacOS, or Windows. Please see the `OpenStack Training " "Labs <https://docs.openstack.org/training_labs/>`_." msgstr "" "Training Labs 스크립트는 해당 설치 가이드에서 설명하는 내용을 기반으로 클러스" "터를 VirtualBox 또는 KVM VM에 배포하는 자동화된 방법을 제공합니다. 최소 8 GB " "메모리 및 20 GB 사용 가능한 스토리지 공간을 가진 Linux, MacOS, 또는 Windows" "를 실행하는 데스크탑 컴퓨터 또는 랩탑을 필요로 합니다. 자세한 내용은 " "`OpenStack Training Labs <https://docs.openstack.org/training_labs/>`_ 를 살" "펴봅니다." msgid ""msgid "" "The following diagram shows the relationships among the OpenStack services:" msgstr "다음 다이어그램에서는 OpenStack 서비스간 관계를 보여줍니다:" msgid "" "The following table provides a list of services that require passwords and " "their associated references in the guide." msgstr "" "다음 표에서는 암호를 필요로 하는 서비스 목록과 가이드 내 관련된 레퍼런스를 제" "공합니다." "This guide covers step-by-step deployment of the major OpenStack services " "using a functional example architecture suitable for new users of OpenStack " "with sufficient Linux experience. This guide is not intended to be used for " "production system installations, but to create a minimum proof-of-concept " "for the purpose of learning about OpenStack." msgstr "" "이 가이드는 충분한 리눅스 경험이 있는 OpenStack의 새로운 사용자를 위하여 적합" "한 기능적인 아키텍처 예제를 사용하여 주요 OpenStack 서비스의 단계별로 배포하" "는 것을 다룹니다. 이 가이드는 production 시스템 설치에 사용하는 것이 아니며, " "OpenStack에 대하여 배우기위한 목적으로 최소한의 poc를 작성하기 위한 것입니다." msgid "" "This guide documents the installation of OpenStack starting with the Pike " "release. It will cover multiple releases in the future." msgstr "" "이 가이드는 Pike 릴리즈를 시작으로 OpenStack에 대한 설치를 문서화합니다. 향" "후 여러 릴리즈를 포함하여 다룰 것입니다." msgid """This guide will show you how to install OpenStack by using packages on " "openSUSE Leap 42.3 and SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 12 SP3 through the Open " "Build Service Cloud repository." msgstr "" "이 가이드는 Open Build Service Cloud 저장소를 통해 openSUSE 42.3과 SUSE " "Linux Enterprise Server 12 SP3 상의 패키지를 사용하여 OpenStack을 설치하는 방" "법을 보여줄 것입니다." msgid """This section creates the necessary virtual networks to support launching " "instances. Networking option 1 includes one provider (external) network with " "one instance that uses it. Networking option 2 includes one provider network " "with one instance that uses it and one self-service (private) network with " "one instance that uses it. The instructions in this section use command-line " "interface (CLI) tools on the controller node. However, you can follow the " "instructions on any host that the tools are installed. For more information " "on the CLI tools, see the `OpenStackClient documentation for Pike <https://" "docs.openstack.org/python-openstackclient/pike/cli/command-objects/server." "html#server-create>`__. To use the dashboard, see the `Dashboard User " "Documentation for Pike <https://docs.openstack.org/horizon/pike/user/>`__." msgstr "" "이번 섹션에서는 인스턴스 구동을 지원하기 위해 필요한 가상 네트워크를 만듭니" "다. 네트워킹 옵션 1은 하나의 프로바이더 (외부) 네트워크와 하나의 인스턴트 사" "용을 포함합니다. 네트워킹 옵션 2는 프로바이더 네트워크 및 이를 사용하는 인스" "턴스 하나와 함께 하나의 셀프 서비스 (사설) 네트워크 및 이를 사용하는 인스턴" "스 하나를 포함합니다. 이 섹션에서의 명령은 컨트롤러 노드에서 커맨드 라인 인터" "페이스(CLI) 툴을 사용합니다. CLI 툴에 대한 자세한 내용은 `OpenStackClient " "documentation for Pike <https://docs.openstack.org/python-openstackclient/" "pike/cli/command-objects/server.html#server-create>`__ 를 확인하십시오. 대시" "보드 사용법은 `Dashboard User Documentation for Pike <https://docs.openstack." "org/horizon/pike/user/>`__ 를 확인하면 됩니다." msgid """To ease the installation process, this guide only covers password security " "where applicable. You can create secure passwords manually, but the database " "connection string in services configuration file cannot accept special " "characters like "@". We recommend you generate them using a tool such as " "`pwgen <https://sourceforge.net/projects/pwgen/>`_, or by running the " "following command:" msgstr "" "설치 과정을 쉽게 하기 위해, 이 가이드에서는 적용 가능한 암호 보안만을 다룹니" "다. 안전한 암호를 수동으로
" " 생성할 수 있으나, 서비스 구성 파일에 사용하는 데이터베이스 접속 문자열에는 " ""@" 와 같은 특수 문자를
" " 허용하지 않습니다. `pwgen <https://sourceforge.net/projects/pwgen/>`_ 과 같" "은 도구를 사용하거나 다음 명령어를 사용하는 것을 권장합니다:" msgid ""msgid "" "To properly synchronize services among nodes, you can install Chrony, an " "implementation of :term:`NTP <Network Time Protocol (NTP)>`. We recommend " "that you configure the controller node to reference more accurate (lower " "stratum) servers and other nodes to reference the controller node." msgstr "" "노드 사이에 서비스들을 적절히 동기화하도록 하기 위해 :term:`NTP <Network " "Time Protocol (NTP)>` 를 구현하는 Chrony를 설치할 수 있습니다. 컨트롤러 노드" "가 보다 정확한 (stratum이 낮은) 서버를 가리키도록 하고 다른 노드들은 컨트롤" "러 노드를 가리키토록 구성할 것을 권장합니다." "Ubuntu does not enable a restrictive :term:`firewall` by default. For more " "information about securing your environment, refer to the `OpenStack " "Security Guide <https://docs.openstack.org/security-guide/>`_." msgstr "" "Ubuntu에는 기본적으로 :term:`firewall` 이 활성화되어 있으며, 제한된 범위만을 " "허용하고 있습니다. 사용자 환경에 대한 보안을 강화하는 것에 대한 자세한 정보" "는 `OpenStack Security Guide <https://docs.openstack.org/security-guide/>`_ " "를 참고하십시오." msgid ""msgid "" "Users can access OpenStack via the web-based user interface implemented by " "the Horizon Dashboard, via `command-line clients <https://docs.openstack.org/" "cli-reference/>`__ and by issuing API requests through tools like browser " "plug-ins or :command:`curl`. For applications, `several SDKs <https://" "developer.openstack.org/#sdk>`__ are available. Ultimately, all these access " "methods issue REST API calls to the various OpenStack services." msgstr "" "사용자는 Horizon 대시보드에 의해 구현된 웹 기반 사용자 인터페이스를 통해, " "`command-line clients <https://docs.openstack.org/cli-reference/>`__ 를 통" "해, 그리고 API 요청을 브라우저 플러그인 또는 :command:`curl` 와 같은 도구를 " "통해 발행함으로써 OpenStack에 액세스할 수 있습니다. 응용 프로그램에 대해서는 " "`several SDKs <https://developer.openstack.org/#sdk>`__ 를 사용할 수 있습니" "다. 결론적으로, 모든 해당 액세스 방식은 REST API 요청을 다양한 OpenStack 서비" "스에 발행합니다." msgid "`Ceilometer <https://docs.openstack.org/ceilometer/latest/>`__" msgstr subject: Implement "dns-backend" binding
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-12 15:30:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-designate/commit/62be31ab59815ff30fe2e0598a71ae7f8ddbe593', 'message': 'Implement "dns-backend" binding

This patchset implements "dns-backend" binding which is required to
properly handle DNS zone transfers between designate and
desigante-bind applications. If "dns-backend" binding is provided
when deploying designate and designate-bind applications, DNZ zone
transfers will now take place over the subnet which belongs to the
provided space.

Depends-On: https://github.com/openstack/charm-interface-bind-rndc/pull/1
Depends-On: Icbe0cc790c565f125f0fe8c903e9b755fe764d7c
Change-Id: I2c7b95e630611ac16c19e7f9efb81f54802849e9
Closes-Bug: #1722794

properly handle DNS zone transfers between designate and
desigante-bind applications. If "dns-backend" binding is provided
when deploying designate and designate-bind applications, DNZ zone
transfers will now take place over the subnet which belongs to the
provided space.

Depends-On: I927e3958cf929ace9d43f8b3d9509b90b9eab60f
Depends-On: I2dd8c78e80a395354bcb634c0c715dadc6e84201
Change-Id: I2c7b95e630611ac16c19e7f9efb81f54802849e9
Closes-Bug: #1722794

commit_message:
Implement "dns-backend" binding

This patchset implements support for "dns-backend" binding. Use the
"dns-backend" relation network space binding to populate the list
of dns master servers in the designate pool configuration,
ensuring that communication between master and slave servers
happens over the correct network space.

Depends-On: I927e3958cf929ace9d43f8b3d9509b90b9eab60f
Depends-On: Icbe0cc790c565f125f0fe8c903e9b755fe764d7c
Change-Id: I2c7b95e630611ac16c19e7f9efb81f54802849e9
Closes-Bug: #1722794
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-designate refs/changes/07/511507/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @reactive.when('dns-backend.connected') def setup_backend(backend): if hookenv.network_get_primary_address('dns-backend'): rndc_address = hookenv.network_get_primary_address('dns-backend') else: rndc_address = hookenv.unit_private_ip() backend.register_masters(rndc_address=rndc_address)

deleted_lines: - hosts: all name: Autoconverted job legacy-senlinclient-dsvm-functional from old job gate-senlinclient-dsvm-functional-nv tasks: - name: Ensure legacy workspace directory file: path: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' state: directory - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x cat > clonemap.yaml << EOF clonemap: - name: openstack-infra/devstack-gate dest: devstack-gate EOF /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner -m clonemap.yaml --cache-dir /opt/git \ git://git.openstack.org \ openstack-infra/devstack-gate executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x cat << 'EOF' >>"/tmp/dg-local.conf" [[local|localrc]] enable_plugin senlin https://git.openstack.org/openstack/senlin enable_service sl-api sl-eng EOF executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x export PYTHONUNBUFFERED=true export BRANCH_OVERRIDE=default export KEEP_LOCALRC=1 export PROJECTS="openstack/senlin $PROJECTS" export DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT=python-senlinclient export SENLIN_BACKEND="openstack_test" if [ "$BRANCH_OVERRIDE" != "default" ] ; then export OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH=$BRANCH_OVERRIDE fi function pre_test_hook { cd /opt/stack/new/python-senlinclient/senlinclient/tests/functional/ ./pre_test_hook.sh } export -f pre_test_hook function post_test_hook { cd /opt/stack/new/python-senlinclient/senlinclient/tests/functional/ ./post_test_hook.sh } export -f post_test_hook cp devstack-gate/devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}'

subject: Refactor Loader component
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-03 13:48:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ui/commit/b88a762deca4812559e23e96940f6f05cd6b4507', 'message': 'Refactor Loader component

Loader component is carries too much logic and this makes adding
another types of loaders complicated. (e.g. overlay loader)

This change creates BaseLoader component which handles loading
logic and Loader component is refactored into several *Loader
components which use BaseLoader internally

Modifications in other files than ui/Loader.js are just loader
component renaming

commit_message:
Refactor Loader component

Loader component carries too much logic and this makes adding
other types of loaders complicated. (e.g. overlay loader)

This change creates BaseLoader component which handles loading
logic and Loader component is refactored into several *Loader
components which use BaseLoader internally

Modifications in other files than ui/Loader.js are just loader
component renaming

Change-Id: I8324f1467c90935d0d233d3472fd4257ae57c07d

commit_message:
Add a .htaccess for redirecting old paths

This commit adds an .htaccess file to the tempest docs to handle
redirecting old paths to the new location. Before the docs migration in
the past we had docs located at docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest and
now things are located in docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest. With this
file we should be properly redirecting old links to the new location.

Change-Id: Idec7b2f299ade9b7dcc678ea1daf8daa25f08c44
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/89/518189/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: redirectmatch 301 ^/developer/tempest/(.*) ^/tempest/latest/$1

commit_message:
use metering api def from neutron-lib

The metering extension's API definition was rehomed into neutron-lib
with commit I1b3285287be2429f7cf9913a7e6204db26371ced. This patch
consumes the API definition removing the rehomed code from neutron
and updating references to use lib's code.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: Iacd69a3b332ee494946befc2f35638410e27cfb9

commit_message:
use ip allocation api def from neutron-lib

The IP allocation extension's API definition was rehomed into
neutron-lib with commit Ifebe1d5e623a16ae46598c19b7d904fe913ce2d3
This patch consumes the API definition by removing the rehomed code and
using the APIExtensionDescriptor for the extension class.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: Ic44c55f6aa2c6ea8f67f9d17e904ad695ff655df

commit_message:
Remove hdfs job from check queue

In the manila weekly community meeting it was resolved [1]
to remove unmaintained drivers from the check queue to avoid
waste of infrastructure resources and to remove "red noise"
from the gerrit review pages.

Do so for the hdfs driver.  Leave the job defined as it is run
in devstack-hdfs-plugin.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-meeting-alt/%23openstack-meeting-alt.2017-11-02.log.html#t2017-11-02T15:26:17

Change-Id: Ifdd55572e9a2ba243fe074476d9459acaf474f54
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/47/517647/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add DNS APIs

OVN Northbound DB has DNS table. Support CRUD operations for
this table. These APIs will be used by networking-ovn to use
OVN's native DNS feature.

Note: ovn-nbctl do not support these APIs as of now. But it is
good to have these in ovsdbapp and it will be useful.

Partial-bug: #1688172

Change-Id: I5528829eef0a7534d9266bb3abc2aec269e4ba35
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp refs/changes/27/497227/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class DnsAddCommand(cmd.AddCommand): table_name = 'DNS' def __init__(self, api, **external_ids): super(DnsAddCommand, self).__init__(api) self.external_ids = external_ids def run_idl(self, txn): dns = txn.insert(self.api.tables[self.table_name]) dns.external_ids = self.external_ids self.result = dns.uuid class DnsDelCommand(cmd.DbDestroyCommand): def __init__(self, api, uuid): super(DnsDelCommand, self).__init__(api, 'DNS', record) class DnsGetCommand(cmd.BaseGetRowCommand): table = 'DNS' class DnsListCommand(cmd.BaseCommand): def run_idl(self, txn): table = self.api.tables['DNS'] self.result = [rowview.RowView(r) for r in table.rows.values()] class DnsSetRecordsCommand(cmd.BaseCommand): def __init__(self, api, row_uuid, **records): super(DnsSetRecordsCommand, self).__init__(api) self.row_uuid = row_uuid self.records = records def run_idl(self, txn): try: dns = self.api.lookup('DNS', self.row_uuid) dns.records = self.records except idlutils.RowNotFound: msg = "DNS %s does not exist" % self.row_uuid raise RuntimeError(msg) class DnsAddRecordCommand(cmd.BaseCommand): def __init__(self, api, row_uuid, hostname, addresses): super(DnsAddRecordCommand, self).__init__(api) self.row_uuid = row_uuid self.hostname = hostname self.addresses = addresses def run_idl(self, txn): try: dns = self.api.lookup('DNS', self.row_uuid) dns.records[self.hostname] = self.addresses except idlutils.RowNotFound: msg = "DNS %s does not exist" % self.row_uuid raise RuntimeError(msg) class DnsDelRecordCommand(cmd.BaseCommand): def __init__(self, api, row_uuid, hostname): super(DnsAddRecordCommand, self).__init__(api) self.row_uuid = row_uuid self.hostname = hostname def run_idl(self, txn): try: dns = self.api.lookup('DNS', self.row_uuid) dns.records.pop(self.hostname, None) except idlutils.RowNotFound: msg = "DNS %s does not exist" % self.row_uuid raise RuntimeError(msg)

commit_message:
[CLI] Improve Rally DB UX

- By default hide creds when running rally db show
- Add option --creds to show them
- Print results of operations as well as connection string to DB

Change-Id: Ifc8ee8ee7b38821409d29ccfe66903e891e12ad3

commit_message:
Enable in-cluster loadbalancing of kubernetes API

I originally disabled this because i couldn't successfully deploy the
API this way, but it was probably caused by garbled up node hostnames,
which was fixed in I1c0251be58535d59fe0ec157cb9acaba209e8732.

Change-Id: I0f51e971fad11568c2f9db13c0d1c54122c51f5d

commit_message:
Disable events persister per default

This change fixes devstack installation which attempts to import
Elasticsearch persister repository.

More intuitive options to control loading of repositories are
introduced:

* kafka_metrics.enabled - default=True
* kafka_alarm_history.enabled - default=True
* kafka_events.enabled - default=False

Change-Id: I78707386f2080f37746f9598ba28f738832d9c86
Story: 2001285
Task: 5833

commit_message:
Add TLS for ec2api service

This adds a TLS proxy in front of it so it serves TLS in the
internal network.

bp tls-via-certmonger
Change-Id: I24d990eccf7affd5f3899338ac96d02d2d47460e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/92/509392/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*ec2_api_network*] # (Optional) The network name where the ec2api endpoing is listening on. # This is set by t-h-t. # defaults to hiera('ec2_api_network', undef) # # [*ec2_api_tls_proxy_bind_ip*] # IP on which the TLS proxy will listen on. Required only used if # enable_internal_tls is set. # defaults to undef # # [*ec2_api_tls_proxy_fqdn*] # fqdn on which the tls proxy will listen on. required only used if # enable_internal_tls is set. # defaults to undef # # [*ec2_api_tls_proxy_port*] # port on which the tls proxy will listen on. Only used if # enable_internal_tls is set. # defaults to 8788 # $certificates_specs = hiera('apache_certificates_specs', {}), $enable_internal_tls = hiera('enable_internal_tls', false), $ec2_api_network = hiera('nova_api_network', undef), $step = Integer(hiera('step')) $ec2_api_tls_proxy_bind_ip = undef, $ec2_api_tls_proxy_fqdn = undef, $ec2_api_tls_proxy_port = 8788, if $enable_internal_tls { if !$ec2_api_network { fail('ec2_api_network is not set in the hieradata.') } $ec2_api_tls_certfile = $certificates_specs["httpd-${ec2_api_network}"]['service_certificate'] $ec2_api_tls_keyfile = $certificates_specs["httpd-${ec2_api_network}"]['service_key'] ::tripleo::tls_proxy { 'ec2_api_network': servername => $ec2_api_tls_proxy_fqdn, ip => $ec2_api_tls_proxy_bind_ip, port => $ec2_api_tls_proxy_port, tls_cert => $ec2_api_tls_certfile, tsl_key => $ec2_api_tls_keyfile, } Tripleo::Tls_proxy['ec2api'] ~> Anchor<| title == 'nova::service::begin |> }

subject: sphinxext: Support cliff application
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-13 01:18:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cliff/commit/a98aad839f5fca4469818267c8e89efd0fbdd6b5', 'message': 'sphinxext: directive for cliff app

A new directive cliff-app is introduced in this patch.
There is a case where we would like to generate a reference of
global options of a cliff application. The new directive automates
this process.

The existing autoprogram-cliff direcitive is renamed to cliff-command.
We now have two directives in the cliff sphinxext, so the previous name
is ambiguous now. It is better to use names which associates which
class (App or Command) is processed.
Note that the old name is kept for backward compatibility.

Note that a local copied version of this directive is already used
in python-neutronclient CLI reference.
https://docs.openstack.org/python-neutronclient/latest/cli/neutron-reference.html#neutron-usage

Change-Id: I20e46521a137ca721fae28f10c5cf75d26069e45
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-10-26 06:57:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cliff/commit/6c5dc8d02deadaf80bf279aac72caa36183bfe92', 'message': 'sphinxext: Support cliff application

This commit adds a feature to generate a reference of global
optoions of a cliff application to autoprogram-cliff directive.
If a class path of a cliff application is specified as the argument of
autoprogram-cliff directive, it will be interpreted as a cliff application
and global options of the specified application are rendered.

commit_message:
sphinxext: Support cliff application

This commit adds a feature to generate a reference of global
optoions of a cliff application to autoprogram-cliff directive.
If a class path of a cliff application is specified as the argument of
autoprogram-cliff directive, it will be interpreted as a cliff application
and global options of the specified application are rendered.

Change-Id: I20e46521a137ca721fae28f10c5cf75d26069e45

Fixed issues in the code revealed by exceptions in the tempest build
logs.
These were in different areas of the code:
* dnat - two issues found - reference to removed ports existed &
        uninstall and unbind methods were both calling each other.
        added a cache to identify ports in process so we will avoid
        these loop calls
* dhcp - Ports with IPv6 address only were added to the dhcp, which
        only handles IPv4 packets
* l3_proactive handler - added handling to cases where ports had no
        (or multiple) IP addresses.
* topology: minor old typo bug.

Note - DHCP should be revisited as the code assumes each port may have
just one address - which is not correct.

Change-Id: I14039b3e5752b8ecbc7505a5cb2da3965484c1f6
Closes-Bug: #1728518
'}, {'number': 15, 'created': '2017-11-12 13:41:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow/commit/a2a39303e0e9b4290de1674ec4a72ba441d86b8f', 'message': 'Resolve exceptions found in the tempest log

Fixed issues in the code revealed by exceptions in the tempest build
logs.
These were in different areas of the code:
* dnat - two issues found - reference to removed ports existed &
        uninstall and unbind methods were both calling each other.
        added a cache to identify ports in process so we will avoid

* dhcp - Ports with IPv6 address only were added to the dhcp, which
        only handles IPv4 packets
* l3_proactive handler - added handling to cases where ports had no
        (or multiple) IP addresses.
* topology: minor old typo bug.

Note - DHCP should be revisited as the code assumes each port may have
just one address - which is not correct.

Change-Id: I14039b3e5752b8ecbc7505a5cb2da3965484c1f6

commit_message:
Resolve dhcp exceptions found in the tempest log

Fixed issues in the code revealed by exceptions in the tempest build
logs.
Ports with IPv6 address only were added to the dhcp, which only handles
      IPv4 packets

Note - DHCP should be revisited as the code assumes each port may have
just one address - which is not correct.

Change-Id: I14039b3e5752b8ecbc7505a5cb2da3965484c1f6
Closes-Bug: #1728518

commit_message:
Increase the zuul tasks timeout

As some of our build tasks fail on timeout from time to time, I am
changing the timeout for the build tasks to 3 hours (10800 seconds).
Hopefully this will resolve the timeout. If not, we should check with
the openstack-infra team to find the root cause for these timeouts.

P.S. Tried the syntax in the following URL:
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack-infra/infra-specs/specs/zuulv3.html#jobs
but it still does not work - changed to seconds

Change-Id: I371430e4b4c312c034fc88f4a959bb563e53d2de

commit_message:
placement: rewrite AllocationCandidates.get_by_filters

Using the AggregatedProviderSummaryList object to implement it.

The whole process underlayer as below:
* Get a list of resource provider ids, those resource provider satisfy
  the request sources if it has. If the resource provider proviers all
  the request resources and satisfy the amount, it will be in the list.
  If resource provider providers part of request resources and satisfy
  the amount will be in the list also, will figure out whether this
  resource provider can share resource from other resource provider.
* Populate the usages based on that list of resource provider ids
* Populate the traits based on that list of resource provider ids
* Construct the a list of ProviderSummay objects based on those provider
* Building the mapping between shared and non-shared resource providers
  as AggregatedProviderSummary object.
* Filter out the AggregatedProviderSummay object doesn't have all the
  requested resources based on the resource class id.
* Generate the AllocationRequest and ProviderSummay object from the
  AggregatedProviderSummay object.

Change-Id: I65f24a9697254354f2aac18c9ee77c93f6c9e9d0
Partial-implement-blueprint add-trait-support-in-allocation-candidates

commit_message:
Add AggregatedProviderSummary and AggregatedProviderSummaryList objects

"AggregatedProviderSummaryList.get_all_with_any_resource" method will
generate a list of AggregatedProviderSummary objects based on a plain
list of ProviderSummary objects. The main goal of AggregatedProviderSummary
List object is generating the mapping of shared and non-shared resource provider.
Grouping the shared and non-shared resource provider together as an
AggregatedProviderSummary object.

So each of AggregatedProviderSummary object can be a single resource provider
which provides all the requested resources. It also can be a list of
resource providers which provides all the requested resources, those
resource providers are in the same aggregate.

The AggregatedProviderSummary hides the detail of shared or non-shared
provider. Using the AggregatedProviderSummary.has_resources method to
detect whether the provider or providers in the AggregatedProviderSummay
object can satisfy.

Change-Id: I64d3b96ccae119c4f03afa7fcbf43382a9775929

added_lines: class TestAggregatedProviderSummary(test.NoDBTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestAggregatedProviderSummary, self).setUp() self.requested_resources = { fields.ResourceClass.STANDARD.index( fields.ResourceClass.VCPU): 1, fields.ResourceClass.STANDARD.index( fields.ResourceClass.MEMORY_MB): 64, fields.ResourceClass.STANDARD.index( fields.ResourceClass.DISK_GB): 1500, } self.context = context.RequestContext('fake', 'fake') def _get_fake_summary_list(self): fake_datas = { 0: ([[0, 10, 0], [1, 10, 0]], []), 1: ([[0, 10, 0], [1, 10, 0]], []), 2: ([[2, 10, 0]], ['MISC_SHARES_VIA_AGGREGATE']) } summary_list = resource_provider.ProviderSummaryList(self.context) summary_list.objects = [] summary_list.shared_providers_by_rc_id = {} summary_list.root_providers_by_rp_id = {} for rp_id, data in fake_datas.items(): p = resource_provider.ProviderSummary(self.context) p.resource_provider = resource_provider.ResourceProvider( self.context) p.resources = [] p.resource_provider.id = rp_id for rc_id, total, used in data[0]: r = resource_provider.ProviderSummaryResource(self.context) r.resource_class = fields.ResourceClass.STANDARD[rc_id] r.capacity = total r.used = used p.resources.append(r) p.traits = [] for trait in data[1]: t = resource_provider.Trait(self.context) t.name = trait p.traits.append(t) if rp_id == 2: summary_list.shared_providers_by_rc_id[2] = [p] else: summary_list.root_providers_by_rp_id[rp_id] = p summary_list.objects.append(p) return summary_list @mock.patch.object(resource_provider.ProviderSummaryList, 'get_all_with_any_resource_and_trait') def test_get_all_with_any_resource_and_trait(self, mock_summary_get_all): mock_summary_get_all.return_value = self._get_fake_summary_list() cls = resource_provider.AggregatedProviderSummaryList agg_summary_list = cls.get_all_with_any_resource_and_trait( self.context, self.requested_resources) self.assertEqual(2, len(agg_summary_list)) res = [] for summary_list in agg_summary_list: rp_ids = [] for summary in summary_list.provider_summaries: rp_ids.append(summary.resource_provider.id) res.append(sorted(rp_ids)) self.assertEqual([[0, 2], [1, 2]], sorted(res))

commit_message:
Add ProviderSummaryList object

The `ProviderSummaryList.get_all_with_any_resource` method
will return a plain list of resource providers, since there may
have shared or non-shared resource provider in the list. And
there is no any mapping between those shared and non-shared
resource providers. The mapping of shared and non-shared
will be processed in high layer object.

And those resource providers will satisfy the requested resources
if it has such resource. The resource provider may only has part of
requested resources and satisfy the request amount, since it has
chance to get other requested resource from shared resource provider
in the same aggregate.

The usages and traits info will be populated also.

Change-Id: Icdb4b09509cb7014399ae20d87b0a97bf2056b78

added_lines: class TestProviderSummaryList(test.NoDBTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestProviderSummaryList, self).setUp() self.requested_resources = { fields.ResourceClass.STANDARD.index( fields.ResourceClass.VCPU): 1, fields.ResourceClass.STANDARD.index( fields.ResourceClass.MEMORY_MB): 64, fields.ResourceClass.STANDARD.index( fields.ResourceClass.DISK_GB): 1500, } self.context = context.RequestContext('fake', 'fake') @mock.patch( 'nova.objects.resource_provider._get_provider_ids_with_any_trait') @mock.patch( 'nova.objects.resource_provider._get_providers_with_any_resource') def test_get_all_with_any_resource_and_trait( self, mock_get_providers_with_any_resource, mock_get_providers_with_any_trait): fake_resource_records = { # first rp has all the resources 0: [[0, 8, 4], [1, 128, 64], [2, 4096, 0]], # second rp hasn't disk 1: [[0, 8, 0], [1, 128, 0]] } fake_trait_records = { 0: ['CUSTOM_TRAIT_A', 'CUSTOM_TRAIT_B'], 1: ['CUSTOM_TRAIT_A'] } mock_get_providers_with_any_resource.return_value = ( fake_resource_records) mock_get_providers_with_any_trait.return_value = fake_trait_records res = (resource_provider.ProviderSummaryList. get_all_with_any_resource_and_trait(self.context, self.requested_resources)) self.assertEqual(2, len(res)) for r in res: if r.resource_provider.id == 0: self.assertEqual(3, len(r.resources)) expected_resources = [] for resource in r.resources: expected_resources.append( [fields.ResourceClass.STANDARD.index( resource.resource_class), resource.capacity, resource.used]) self.assertEqual( sorted([[0, 8, 4], [1, 128, 64], [2, 4096, 0]]), sorted(expected_resources)) self.assertEqual(set(['CUSTOM_TRAIT_A', 'CUSTOM_TRAIT_B']), set([t.name for t in r.traits])) elif r.resource_provider.id == 1: self.assertEqual(2, len(r.resources)) expected_resources = [] for resource in r.resources: expected_resources.append( [fields.ResourceClass.STANDARD.index( resource.resource_class), resource.capacity, resource.used]) self.assertEqual( sorted([[0, 8, 0], [1, 128, 0]]), sorted(expected_resources)) self.assertEqual(set(['CUSTOM_TRAIT_A']), set([t.name for t in r.traits]))

Add _get_traits_by_rp_ids method

This method is used to populate the traits for the specific list of
resource providers.

added_lines: def test_get_provider_ids_with_any_trait(self): rp_obj._ensure_rc_cache(self.ctx) # Create the three providers cn1_uuid = uuidsentinel.cn1 cn1 = rp_obj.ResourceProvider( self.ctx, name='cn1', uuid=cn1_uuid, ) cn1.create() cn2_uuid = uuidsentinel.cn2 cn2 = rp_obj.ResourceProvider( self.ctx, name='cn2', uuid=cn2_uuid, ) cn2.create() cn3_uuid = uuidsentinel.cn3 cn3 = rp_obj.ResourceProvider( self.ctx, name='cn3', uuid=cn3_uuid, ) cn3.create() t_a = rp_obj.Trait( self.ctx, name='CUSTOM_TRAIT_A' ) t_a.create() t_b = rp_obj.Trait( self.ctx, name='CUSTOM_TRAIT_B' ) t_b.create() # cn1 has no traits. c2 has 'CUSTOM_TRAIT_A', cn3 has 'CUSTOM_TRAIT_A' # and 'CUSTOM_TRAIT_B' cn2.set_traits(rp_obj.TraitList(objects=[t_a])) cn3.set_traits(rp_obj.TraitList(objects=[t_a, t_b])) rp_ids = rp_obj._get_provider_ids_with_any_trait( self.ctx, ['CUSTOM_TRAIT_A', 'CUSTOM_TRAIT_B']) self.assertEqual(set(), rp_ids[cn1.id]) self.assertEqual(set([t_a.id]), rp_ids[cn2.id]) self.assertEqual(set([t_a.id, t_b.id]), rp_ids[cn3.id])

commit_message:
Enable _get_usages_by_provider_and_rc not filter on the resource class id

The resource provider summary in the allocation candidates API should include
all the resources, not only the requested resource. This patch enables the
'rc_ids' parameter can accept None value, it means not filter on the resource
class id to get usages for all the resources. In later patch, the implement
of 'AllocationCandidates.get_all_by_filters' will be rewritten, then the 'rc_ids'
parameter will be removed.

TODO(those todos may can be done after the rewrite AllocationCandidate.get_by_filters,
then the existed code doesn't depend on the current interface anymore.):
* use namedtuple instead of this
* remove uuid column, since after the rewrite, it is usell
* remove the rc_ids parameter after rewrite

Partial-implement-blueprint add-trait-support-in-allocation-candidates
Change-Id: I93bf63ab7f0ccba7b0a8b264443d80f0d7bf90c1

commit_message:
Add _get_providers_with_most_resource method

This method returns a dict, keyed by resource provider id, valued by
resource provider uuid.

Each resource provider will satisfy the requested resources if it has
such resource inventory. So this method just generate a list of
candidate resource providers, each resource provider may has part of
requested resources. We will figure out whether those resource providers
satisfy the request by sharing the resources from other resource providers
in the higher layer code.

Partial-implement-blueprint add-trait-support-in-allocation-candidates
Change-Id: I37dcfbee8524c067720f626fecbc30484f4774ba
